paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and clinical significance.

patients.demographics: 711 with wild-type, 205 with V122I, 118 with non-V122I

functional_data.summary: Patients with the V122I variant had significantly worse survival compared to those with non-V122I variants or wild-type TTR.

variants.population_frequency: 3% to 4% of the African-American population in the United States.
variants.additional_notes: Patients with the V122I variant had a median survival of 2.6 years.
key_quotes: Prognosis in hereditary TTR amyloidosis is modified by specific genotype and subsequent degree of cardiac involvement in phenotype.

Patients with the V122I variant had significantly worse survival (median survival of 2.6 years) compared with those with non-V122I variants (median survival of 5.8 years) or wild-type TTR (median survival of 4.8 years).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
